intro: Linociera welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitschia mirabilis, is a unique and ancient plant native to the Namib Desert in Namibia. It is one of the oldest known seed plants, with a lineage dating back over 140 million years. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it conserve water in its arid environment. It also possesses a thick, woody trunk that stores water and provides structural support. Linociera welwitschii is highly adapted to extreme desert conditions, making it a remarkable example of botanical resilience.
